chapter.p: 1That which came as the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah concerning the matterHebrew “matters” of the severe drought.

ul.li1: 2“Judah mourns, and her gates languish,
ul.li2: they are in mourning on the ground,
and the cry of lament of Jerusalem goes up.
ul.li1: 3And their nobles send their servants for water.
ul.li2: They come to the pits, they find no water.
ul.li1: They return with their vessels empty.Literally “without success”
ul.li2: They are ashamed, and they are confounded,
and they cover their heads.Hebrew “head”
ul.li1: 4Because of the ground, which is cracked
ul.li2: because there was no rain on the ground.
ul.li1: The farmers are ashamed,
ul.li2: they cover their heads.Hebrew “head”
ul.li1: 5For even the doe in the field gives birth and forsakes her young,Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation
ul.li2: because there is no green growth.
ul.li1: 6And wild asses stand on the barren heights,
ul.li2: they gasp for breath like the jackals.
ul.li1: Their eyes fail
ul.li2: because there is no vegetation.”
ul.li1: 7Although our iniquities testify against us, O Yahweh,
ul.li2: act for the sake of your name.
ul.li1: Yes, our apostasies are many;
ul.li2: we have sinned against you.
ul.li1: 8You are the hope of Israel,
ul.li2: its savior in time of distress.
ul.li1: Why should you be like an alien in the land,
ul.li2: or like a traveler who spreads out his tent Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation to spend the night?
ul.li1: 9Why should you be like a confused man,
ul.li2: like a warrior who is not able to help?
ul.li1: Yet you are in our midst, O Yahweh,
ul.li2: and your name is called upon us.
ul.li1: You must not leave us!
“They have loved so much to wander,
ul.li2: they have not spared their feet.
ul.li1: Therefore Yahweh is not favorable to them,
ul.li2: now he will remember their iniquity and punish their sins.”

chapter.p: 11So Yahweh said to me, “You must not pray for this people, for their happiness.Or “good” 12Although they fast, I am not listening to their cry of entreaty. And although they present burnt offering and grain offering, I am not favorable to them. But by the sword, and by the famine, and by the plague, I am about to destroy them.” 13Then I said, “Ah, Lord Yahweh, look, the prophets are saying to them, ‘You will not see the sword, and famine will not be yours, but reliable peace I will give to you in this place.’ ” 14And Yahweh said to me, “The prophets are prophesying liesHebrew “lie” in my name. I have not sent them, and I have not commanded them, and I have not spoken to them. They are prophesying to you a lying vision, and a divination, worthless, and the deceitfulness of their minds.”Literally “heart” 15ThereforeLiterally “To thus” thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets who prophecy in my name though I have not sent them, yet they are saying, “Sword and famine will not be in this land.” “By the sword and by the famine those prophets will perish. 16And the people to whom they are prophesying will be cast out into the streets of Jerusalem because ofLiterally “from the face of” the famine and the sword. And there will be no one who buries them, their wives, or their sons, or their daughters. And I will pour out on them their wickedness.
17“And you shall say to them this word,

ul.li1: ‘Let my eyes melt with tears night and day,
ul.li2: and let them not cease,
ul.li1: for with a great wound the virgin daughter of my people is broken,
ul.li2: with a very incurable wound.
ul.li1: 18If I go out into the field,
ul.li2: then look, those slain by the sword.
ul.li1: And if I enter the city,
ul.li2: then look, the sickness of the famine.
ul.li1: For both prophet and priest wander around through the land,
ul.li2: they do not know what is going on.’ ”Literally “and not they know”
ul.li1: 19Have you completely rejected Judah?
ul.li2: Or has your soulOr “inner self” loathed Zion?
ul.li1: Why have you struck us
ul.li2: so that there is no healing for us?
ul.li1: We hope for peace, but there is no good,
ul.li2: and for a time of healing, but look, there is terror.
ul.li1: 20We know, O Yahweh, our wickedness,
ul.li2: the iniquity of our ancestors,Or “fathers”
for we have sinned against you.
ul.li1: 21You must not spurn usHere the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation for the sake of your name,
ul.li2: you must not dishonor your glorious throne.Literally “the throne of your glory”
ul.li1: Remember us!Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation
ul.li2: You must not break your covenant with us.
ul.li1: 22Are there any among the idols of the nation who cause rain to pour?
ul.li2: Or can the heavens give showers?
ul.li1: Is it not you, O Yahweh our God?
ul.li2: Therefore, we hope in you, for you do all these things.
